text.content:
Pt presents to Mental Health Urgent Care clinic c/o depression, and lost 
medications on the bus.  Recent history of hx of SI and hospitalized 2/15 - 
2/28.

On call Psychiatry agreed to refill meds, pharmacy will dispence them at the 
window.

  Depression Screening:
    PHQ-2
      A PHQ-2 screen was performed. The score was 2 which is a negative
          screen for depression.

          1. Little interest or pleasure in doing things
          Several days

          2. Feeling down, depressed, or hopeless
          Several days
    PHQ-9
      A PHQ-9 screen was performed. The score was 10 which is suggestive
          of moderate depression.

          1. Little interest or pleasure in doing things
          Several days

          2. Feeling down, depressed, or hopeless
          Several days

          3. Trouble falling or staying asleep, or sleeping too much
          More than half the days

          4. Feeling tired or having little energy
          Several days

          5. Poor appetite or overeating
          Several days

          6. Feeling bad about yourself or that you are a failure or have
          let yourself or your family down
          More than half the days

          7. Trouble concentrating on things, such as reading the
          newspaper or watching television
          Several days

          8. Moving or speaking so slowly that other people could have
          noticed. Or the opposite being so fidgety or restless that you
          have been moving around a lot more than usual
          Not at all

          9. Thoughts that you would be better off dead or of hurting
          yourself in some way
          Several days

          10. If you checked off any problems, how DIFFICULT have these
          problems made it for you to do your work, take care of things at
          home or get along with other people?
          Somewhat difficult

Suicide Risk evaluation
Protective factors:
        Children, friends, and church provider good social support
        No Fire Arms in the home
        Patient identified resaon to live = Good of her Children
        Medication compliance
        Suicide Plan - none
        No current Suicidal thoughts, or thoughts of hopelessness

Risk Factors:
        Depression
        History of Suicidal thoughts and thoughts of hopelessness
        Family History of Depression
        Stress (difficult childcare issues and ex-husband) 

Assessment: low to moderate risk

Plan: Refill meds, schedule an intact exam with Mental Health for this week

Patient provided contact information for the Mental Health Clinic, the Urgent 
Care Clinic, the ER and the national Suicide Prevention hotline.  Patient 
verbalizes that she will call us or 911 if she has thoughts of harming herself.
text.author: AVIVAUSER,TWENTYNINE

text.content:
Patient has a PCP appointment on Tuesday, per policy pharmacy has done a 7 day 
partial fill as a bridge.
text.author: PSYCHIATRIST,THREE
